reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best series evet

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Mmmhmm next please :)
reviews.reviewText: 4.5 StarsOooh this was a good one. Love the MC's. I was definitely focused more on the mystery plot than the romance. Two twists and both shocked me.I had forgotten how much insta-love there is in mystery romance genre. Even with that it was an enjoyable read and I will be moving on to the next book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific Murder Mysery
reviews.reviewText: Kendra Elliott never fails to provide a fast-moving mystery with well-developed characters and intricate story line. The heroine and hero also managed to have a romance while saving the brother and his son.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An disturbing, but intriguing story
reviews.reviewText: I have loved Kendra Elliot's books since I stumbled on the first one years ago. As an Oregonian, I appreciate her descriptions of Oregon and the Northwest. Her characters are interesting and one you become invested in. This one has disturbing subject matter, because it sadly could be true, but don't avoid it because of that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: So many twist and turns I felt like I was on a roller coaster, but a good one. There was romance, murder and mystery what more could anyone ask for.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Loved it! The twists and turns were not expected. Well written and a great read. I am really enjoying this series with visits here and there from previous characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book searches for the truth of what happened. The long journey for that answer takes the reader on a roller coaster ride! Excellent book! I couldn’t put it down!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Formulaic, but fair
reviews.reviewText: Overall, a solid read, but as I was able to put it down and didn't feel compelled to finish it, can't say it was an exceptional read. Here are the pros and cons:Pros: Fast paced story with a lot of intrigue. There were many twists and turns which kept you curious as to how everything would weave together.Cons: VERY formulaic - I knew who the villain would be about a quarter of the way through the book and just waited for the story to play out the "why". Over the top romance - I love a little romance, but if the female character's "flaw" is she's unquestionably stunning but doesn't know it, there's no interest. It is so unbelievable and over the top. What woman fears about being seen as too beautiful? Definitely not written for a female audience. Give her a crooked nose or a rounded stomach or have her two front teeth cross, but making her an athletic Cleopatra is too unrelatable and therefore unbelievable. Additionally, although I do think love at first sight can exist, again WAY WAY WAY over the top with the instant infatuation and possessiveness of a person you just met. Lust can be instantaneous, sure, but....he immediately knows she is the woman he wants to marry because she is so darn hot? Honestly, as a woman, that did nothing for me. Give her a personality and let him fall in love with that, not just because she's hot, with a smokin' body and is vulnerable so could use a big strong man to cry to. Lastly, the plot...as awful as describing horrible things can be, if you are trying to paint a horrible scene, you have to give some of the gory details. It is clear there are lots of deaths from a serial killer within the first 20 pages of the book, but the author shares only a baseline of information to let you know people were beaten and killed. Then much, much later in the book she uses character comments / conversations like, 'we need to protect children from pedaphiles' to let the readers know the perpetrator was a pedaphile. By this point, it is so late in the story I don't have the same emotional attachment or repulsion that otherwise would have had, and without some graphic detail, no insight to what that word really means in context of the story. I wasn't rooting for the killer to be brought to justice, which is a shame considering how perverse the author is trying to make the perpetrator in this story. Lastly, way too many 'Hero' moments. Author does a great job trying to explain them away, realizing it is irrational to leave a person alone for half an hour after you refused to let the person out of your sight for minutes. Or illogical to leave a room without a phone or wallet to meet a stranger but not let anyone know where you are going even though there is a killer stalking you. But the explanations are weak, along the lines of the character saying, "what was I thinking, trying to be the hero on my own?" My reply is, what was I thinking, continuing to read the ridiculous scene?I realize way more cons than pros, sorry. I think the author is a good writer and creative, but went more for trite, commonplace, and formulaic for this book. Read more like a what I imagine a harlequin romance novel would be. For me, this didn't work. For those looking for PG-13 romance with unrealistic characters who are straight out of a Hollywood set, you will likely like this book. I think this would do well with young adults.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: When everything you thought you knew turns out to be lies....
reviews.reviewText: Michael and Jamie both lived through the same nightmare as children, but with very different outcomes, which resulted in them living very different lives. When long buried bodies are uncovered there are more questions than answers and Michael and Jamie have to work together to keep Jamie alive and to find her brother Chris.They last saw each other as broken and devastated teenagers, this meeting uncovers very different feelings for both of Michael and Jamie. We have seen Michael in protective mode before with Lacey, but here everything is intensified and he finally realises the love and protection he felt for Lacy were brotherly and there is nothing brotherly about his feelings for Jamie.....he has finally found his match!It is a long and emotional fight as they uncover secrets, lies and corruption at the highest level and a little too close to home. This is a haunting book that will leave you emotionally exhausted but eager for more from the Bone Secrets series.I read this on Kindle Unlimited.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard to not finish the book
reviews.reviewText: Yet another amazing story by Kendra. Beautifully written and really difficult to not shed tears to what is an amazingly heart-wrenching book

reviews.reviewTitle: Enjoyable thriller with a bit of romance
reviews.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed this thriller. It had all the right ingredients to make it strive. The story is about a school-bus full of children who went missing ten years ago. Only one boy was found alive. Now after ten years, the bones of the missing children are found buried near a farm. All but one boy. It was brilliant. I also enjoyed the brief romance. The big baddy was truly bad but thankfully Elliot didn't go too much into the gruesome crimes. I started to understand who the true culpit was about 70% into the book. But it still made me go on to understand the WHY. I will definitively pick up more from this author.

Bought this for holiday reading and because it was the first in a series and got more than I was expecting. Delightful story, terrific characters that have character and some unexpected surprises from left field. Am now looking forward to reading the next in the series. I'm always a sucker for murder mysteries and I'm ordering the next one as soon as I get home.

reviews.reviewTitle: So la la, kein wirklicher Page Turner, aber insgesamt lesenswert
reviews.reviewText: Das Buch ist recht spannend, aber insgesamt in vielen Dingen zu oberflächlich. Das ist schade, denn man hätte hier die Geschichte deutlich differenzierter und auch detaillierter ausarbeiten können. Auch einige Charaktere wie z.B. "The Senator" bleiben sehr flach.Manche Stellen waren dafür sehr langatmig, deshalb habe ich das Buch irgendwie ein wenig als unausgewogen empfunden. Wer einen spannenden Krimi sucht, welchen man ohne viel Nachzudenken einfach weglesen kann und aushält, dass es hier um gefolterte und ermordete Kinder geht, dem kann man das Buch trotz aller Schwächen empfehlen.
